sentence.Network_en: The background music was provided by an accordion player.
sentence.Network_cn: 背景音乐是由一位手风琴乐手演奏的。

sentence.Network_en: The accordion music in the film isn't very beautiful.
sentence.Network_cn: 这部影片中的手风琴音乐不是很好.

sentence.Network_en: The accordion music reminds me of my boyhood.
sentence.Network_cn: 这手风琴的乐声让我回忆起了我的少年时代.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from German Akkordion, from Italian accordare 'to tune'

entry.def: An accordion is a musical instrument in the shape of a fairly large box which you hold in your hands. You play the accordion by pressing keys or buttons on either side while moving the two sides together and apart. Accordions are used especially to play traditional popular music.

means.word_mean: 1. a portable box-shaped free-reed instrument; the reeds are made to vibrate by air from the bellows controlled by the player

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"某种物,用品;人等"; 2. 表名词,"动作或状态等"
